DataElement.preferredName: Hospitalized Myocardial Infarction Fatal Coronary Disease Occurrence Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of a hospitalized myocardial infarction (gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area)event or fatal coronary heart disease (CHD).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hospitalized Myocardial Infarction Fatal Coronary Disease Event Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to a hospitalized myocardial infarction (gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area) or fatal coronary heart disease (CHD).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Myocardial Infarction Fatal Coronary Disease Event
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area. (Dorland, 27th ed):No value exists.:An imbalance between myocardial functional requirements and the capacity of the coronary vessels to supply sufficient blood flow. It is a form of MYOCARDIAL ISCHEMIA (insufficient blood supply to the heart muscle) caused by a decreased capacity of the coronary vessels.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

Narrowing of the coronary arteries due to fatty deposits inside the arterial walls. The diagnostic criteria may include documented history of any of the following: documented coronary artery stenosis greater than or equal to 50% (by cardiac catheterization or other modality of direct imaging of the coronary arteries); previous coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG); previous percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI); previous myocardial infarction. (ACC)
Something that happens at a given place and time.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
